ofx:section.ofx:title: Installation of Eclipse (Luna)
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: In computer programming, Eclipse is an integrated development environment (IDE). It contains a base workspace and an extensible plug-in system for customizing the environment. Written mostly in Java, Eclipse can be used to develop applications in many different programming languages.

The initial codebase originated from IBM VisualAge. The Eclipse software development kit (SDK), which includes the Java development tools, is meant for Java developers. Users can extend its abilities by installing plug-ins written for the Eclipse Platform, such as development toolkits for other programming languages, and can write and contribute their own plug-in modules. Released under the terms of the Eclipse Public License, Eclipse SDK is free and open source software.
Download eclipse-luna from www.eclipse.org Unpack first start of eclipse Workspace (unique ws for each eclipse version if multiple versions are used)

ofx:section.ofx:title: Subversion (SVN)
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: Help - Eclipse Marketplace Find : "Subversive" - Go Install SVN Team Provider 2.0 Confirm - (Proceed even if "Subversive SVN Team Provider 2.0" is not available) - Accept - Finish - Restart

Project Explorer - (r.click) New - Other - Maven - Checkout Maven Projects from SCM - Next - "Find more SCM connectors in the m2e Marketplace""
Find: "subversive" Select "m2e-subversive" - Finish
Next - next - Accept - Finish "unsigned content": OK - RESTART
SVN KIT 1.8.5

ofx:section.ofx:title: Checkout Project From SVN Repository
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph:
Window - Show View - Other - SVN - SVN Repositories
New - "Repository Location", enter URL, username and password. FINISH
Select Trunk - "Checkout as Maven Project" - NEXT - FINISH
